ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk17:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk17:0.5_0: 17. The training rule on swinging the arms
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk17:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk17:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were swinging and dangling their arms while walking in inhabited areas. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk17:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not swing my arms while walking in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk17:1.4_0: he should not swing his arms while walking in inhabited areas;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk17:1.5_0: one should walk keeping one’s arms steady.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk17:1.6_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, swings and dangles his arms while walking in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk17:1.8.1_0: or it has not been trusted ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk17:1.10_0: The seventh rule, the training rule on married girls, is finished.
